lines.text: "No, no, no."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll want to wait until we have more of the others, just in case. I'm afraid the sewers might be being cased as well, so stay put for a little while longer, we'll find you a quiet spot in the Leaky Tap, but let me check with the others.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, okay." All right. As you guys are getting the rest of your morning on, what do you want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get the rest of my morning on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Getting your morning on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to point out, because I took Tough--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I'm at 49 hit points

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damn, dude!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That’s a lot!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But now I burn through more to use my swords.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have to find Dolan now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we found Dolan last night. He's going to stay put in his house, low. We're going to try and assure that he's safe so that he can, you know, put his name up for that High-Richter seat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've got to figure out what we're doing with this thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But listen, the gates, it's not a joke, it's sealed. There are crownsguard swarming all over it. It seemed like they were doing personal interviews, pat-downs, the whole smash, so even an enchantment might not hold up to scrutiny.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wasn't there a woman who was also (whispers) part of the Knights of Requital?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Kara.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happened to her?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She was the most shifty bitch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We didn't see her last night. She wasn't at Dolan's.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But she saw you guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, she saw-- Yes, she did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At one of the meetings.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She never said a whole lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If anyone is going to turn us in, it would be her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Perhaps.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's the one I arguably know the least about--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where's Horris? Maybe he knows something about her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look behind Fjord at this point, and in the doorway is Horris, arms crossed, biting his lower lip.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Horris?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know where Kara is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I honestly don't. We scattered when the preparations were done to make sure we were far "apart so we couldn't be traced together."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know where she lives?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't, actually."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know what she does?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She says she occasionally works out of that really terrible bar, the Evening--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Evening Nip? She works at the Evening Nip?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't go there."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got to get our Nip on. Ooh, wait, maybe not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, Jester and I know the code to talk to the Gentleman if we ever want to do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indeed. I was thinking that we might try and get Horris out now. That way, if a crownsguard finds its way here-- maybe we should take him into the sewers, get him out of the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do the sewers lead out of the city?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I imagine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Generally when a city is on lockdown, though, the sewers is the first place that guards are looking for shady people to leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's true."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where's our cart? We still have our gypsy wagon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, we haven't fed the horses in days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The horses are being taken care of. The horses will be fine. The manticore head, though, that's probably a whole different order of business.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The manticore head. Oh, I bet it smells so bad!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we left the horses at a stable or something? Okay. They're not dead in an alley somewhere?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trying to rip the cart off the dead horses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh! Excuse me!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is our cart in the city or is it outside the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you brought it in the city with you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can bury him under a pile of produce or something like that, try and sneak him out of the city.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we would need a proper smuggler for that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A well-built cart with a secret compartment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get a big catapult and just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you know a smuggler?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I don't know a smuggler. I don't know anybody in this city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, we know a smuggler.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we do know a smuggler.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who was the guy who first showed us around the city?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ulysses! Ulysses Stanneras!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was in that yellow cloak. Remember?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, you know who we haven't checked up on? Bryce's sister. Right? Her sister?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Their sister.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Their sister, sorry. Bryce's sister.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I totally forgot about that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: SAM. And also there's the Gentleman, and also we need a lead box. Oh my God, there's so much to do!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need a lead box. Should we go try to buy a lead box?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or maybe Pumat would have some sort of a magical-encasing--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But how would we tell him why we need it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He doesn't care, does he?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you think somebody would be asking, "Who recently bought something that would protect "against scrying?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Horris, we obviously have a lot to decide on. Perhaps it would be better if you stayed up in the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can do that. I'll lock myself in there, and let me know if anything comes up."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Try and relax. But not too much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." Horris gives you a long look of, "I've learned a lot about you in the moment." (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should write Tusk Love and sell it on the store.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm sure the community is already halfway there, buddy. (laughs) All right. So, Horris is taken care of for the moment. What's the plan?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Broken Veil the name of a tavern here, or was it in Alfield?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Broken Veil?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know I wrote it down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I messed up and I wrote down where she is, but I don't know where--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm trying to find where I wrote down Bryce's connections. I think I wrote it down in a different--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was he in Alfield? She. They! Were they in Alfield?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. Bryce is in Alfield.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bryce Fayled? Fell-lid? Fee-lid?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Feelid. Bryce Feelid. Watchmaster Bryce Feelid. Elf. Leader of the guard. Very sweet person. These are all the things I wrote down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great notes. Jesus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: “Very sweet person.”

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then I wrote down ‘Broken Veil’ and ‘Bluffs’.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's got to be that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where most of the army is sent to defend the Empire in the valley.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Level four,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are ready for this shit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The radiation area in Fallout. It's like, get out! Get out now!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're unprepared!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (computer voice) You are leaving the combat area.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I didn't-- I don't have the name of her

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Their.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Their damn sister!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If Caleb was in the room when Bryce said it, then Caleb would know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think Caleb was, because it was right when we said we were going to Zadash and Bryce was like, "Go look at this person." Sorry, I choked on my spit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bryce was the one that sent you to the Leaky Tap. Bryce is the one that sent you to Claudia.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, is Claudia his sister?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Am I going around in circles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think you're going in circles.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There was no sister?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't recall there--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: --being a sister. It was Claudia!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, if Matt doesn't recall the sister, then it was Claudia!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was Claudia. Was it Claudia this whole time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was like, what did I say about Bryce's sister, oh shit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was Claudia. Never mind!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mystery solved!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No wonder I don't have it in my notes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Once again!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We did it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We figured it out!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Chat's like, "Fucking idiots."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If I did say sister, remind me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that takes one thing off the list. We still need: The lead box! Get Horris out of town! The Gentleman! What else?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Leaky Nip. What's it called?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Evening Nip.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the Gentleman also.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Leaky Nip?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's going to be me in a few months.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bam! Bam!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a daycare.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow. This ain't your kids' D&D, right there!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Leaky Nip? I mean, the Evening Nip, should we go there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we need a lead box, that's probably more important.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And get Horris out first, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pumat's got to have a--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or a blacksmith. I feel like a blacksmith would be more--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's the Spark Hammer Smith. We could go to the Spark Hammer Smith in the Pentamarket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Let's go to that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have we been there yet?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think we actually have been there before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that was the first place we went.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yannick. Jan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the hell of it, make an arcana check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. I've just been nerding out over my leveling up over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He got 75 new spells.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I rolled a one, Matthew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fuck, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rolled a natural 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled it really badly. I'm not good at dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine. All right, continue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need to take Luck as a feat again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It doesn't always work out for you anyway.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know magic some!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a student of magic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not enough, DM says.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not about not enough, it's placement and what you have and where you are. So what are you guys doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to go to the Spark Hammer Smith's. Smithy's.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yannick and Jan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find your way there. Yannick is inside currently, working on hammering out the edges of a piece of armor. "Hello. Can I help you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Do you make anything out of lead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, I certainly can. Depends what you're hoping to have made."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you perhaps make me a really pretty-- so, my mother is a big fan of things made out of lead. She said she likes the color of that metal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's a very curious liking, but sure, I'll take it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She gets a lot of things in gold and stuff and so she says that lead looks very different from that and she thinks it's pretty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey, I'm not judging."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I want to make her a really pretty jewelry box out of lead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The halfling scratches his temple and goes, "Well, I mean, if you're willing to pay, I can make it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay! It's like she has a lot of jewelry, so something like around this big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's going to be a lot of lead, and a few days to make it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can it just be lead-lined? Is that a thing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It can be thin as a sheet of parchment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so not a whole lead box, maybe like a box made out of wood and then pretty lead on the inside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That there's a little more easy to put together."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or maybe on the outside so she doesn't realize it's not made of lead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It doesn't need to be as-- Am I here? I've been doing this with my spells.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you. Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It needs to be sealed all the way around and be able to close.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's a good friend of my mom's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everybody knows her mom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One gold, five silver."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that is acceptable, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here. Will you also engrave it with, "Love you so much"?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It'll be an additional silver."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Come back here in about 48 hours. Should be good."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. If we give you more, could you make it faster?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I could certainly do my best."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I noticed they’re blocking up the gates, and I need to get it to her because her birthday’s coming up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am but one small halfling, so you’re going to have to wait one way or the other."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No worries, mate! Come back then."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our blacksmith is Taika Waititi. So into it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we all in a group, though? Sorry, I really did have my head up the ass of level four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guy haven’t said you’ve split, so I imagine you’re all as a group.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That’s a couple days.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we check with Pumat Sol and see if he has something like that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like a lead-- I would pay premium price to get a hold of a lead box right away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You all keep talking about this Pumat Sol guy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you not been to the Invulnerable Gentleclerk?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I don’t do the magic stuff. I tend to do other things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but this is more like an experience, like Sleep No More. You have to go and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you have to see it for yourself. We do have a lot to do, but this is a functional trip as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m normally not impressed by eccentrics, so this is really impressive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a functional trip as well. A gentleman like Pumat Sol-- gentlemen like Pumat Sols-- would most likely-- because they understand divination, and the needs of the arcane.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See, it feels like an inside joke.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We want you to be in on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He would be more aware of what we're asking for, if we asked for it. As opposed to the blacksmith.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, he would not be surprised by the question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, come over here. Please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, whoever-- everybody hears this. Come closer. Yeah, so--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (belches loudly) (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: My hair went (wind sounds) on that one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I look around to see if anyone was distracted by Fjord’s large belch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment, no. It seems to be a common thing here in the Pentamarket.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. I know you’re all a big fan of my sticky fingers. I took this from Sutan’s house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is that? What does it do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is a sending stone. It's a communication device. This was in Sutan’s house. This was under the rug that we destroyed and removed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That attacked us, you mean.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Honestly, my opinion is, the probability of someone trying to find us, searching for this thing, is like looking for a needle in a haystack in a newly made warzone. However, in the meantime, I was wondering if you’d hold it inside of your fancy bag, because--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will they be able to find it through the fancy bag?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I believe not, because inside your bag is somewhere else. It is not even on this plane.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hold it up to my ear. Is anybody trying to talk to me right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let’s put that in your bag right away, because we don’t know what’s on the other side of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we-- oh, okay. Can they hear me talking to it right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is a very, very small chance the answer is yes, so please put it in your bag right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you started stealing stuff in the first house?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. That is what I said that I was going to do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To be fair, he did say that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We had the talk. I’m willing to let it slide.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We had the talk with her

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That’s fair. Ah! Sword. Boots. Daggers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. Don’t pass it out out here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, not right here, of course.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we want to do it before Pumat, or after Pumat?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One little interjection. Couldn’t we use the sending thing to find out information if we sent a message?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don’t know who it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would it hear our voice, or would it-- ?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It would hear our voice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could disguise our voice and say, "We’ve been made! Send instructions!" and find out what happens.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is true. Just keep it in the bag for now, just in case.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That’s pretty good, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. We could certainly roll this over in our minds and see if there’s something we could do with it. If someone is going to look for this thing-- and, again, probability very low-- but if they were going to look, it’d be right away. It’d be a couple of weeks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we say to it, "Hey man! We found this stone on the ground. Who do you belong to?" What do you think?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It’s better if they initiate, because then we learn information immediately.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sometimes if you scroll through and find a listing for mom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, and then you call the mom?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I believe possible that at some point a message could come through it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That’s what I was thinking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we don’t know. I just want-- for the next two to four weeks-- I would prefer to keep it either in a lead-lined container or in that bag. Chances are small, but if someone was

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It’s possible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. It's in the bag.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pumat, or the rest of the equipment?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could probably divvy up the equipment at Pumat's. He won’t ask any questions.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let’s do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do you know? How do you know he's not working for the Empire?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He’s pretty nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The only store in the Empire.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He seems like a nice guy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's probably working for the Empire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would agree with Fjord's sentiment. If we took it out of my own bag-- There's four of Pumats so one of those Pumats would see it coming out of my own stuff.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus, we’re returning customers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that’s also true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what are you agreeing with? That he's nice or that he's working for the Empire?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, that he's nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don’t want to trust him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could also go to a breakfast shop and do it there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The two aren't mutually exclusive. We know that, right? He can be nice and working for the Empire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I had a dream about Pumat Sol attacking us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You did not!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Attacking us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did. I had a dream about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?! That seems terrible!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is Laura actually. I did have a dream.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What, are you serious? That’s terrifying!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was starting to go in that direction of: Is this a real thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anyway--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is Clarota aftershock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I’m just letting you know. We don't know anything about him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think if you give him a chance, he'll do you right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (banjo music)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anyway, I don't want to bring out all of this stuff from the assassin guy in front of him!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go shopping at Pumat Sol’s and then we’ll divvy up everything when we’re in private.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys making your way to the Pentamarket?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Pumat voice) Respectfully, we are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way to the warm, welcoming interior of the Invulnerable Vagrant. There are no other patrons in there. You do see, across the way, one Pumat Sol is sitting behind the counter with knitting needles. There is one off to the side in a chair that’s currently reading through a book, the small set of glasses on the tip of his wide nose. They both look up and go, "Why, hello there! That's just a real nice thing to see you this "early in the morning. Just about to finish my breakfast snack, so you caught me at a good time."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The fuck?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you open all the time?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is normal, it’s okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not all the time. We generally do a cycle of sunrise to about four hours past sunset. That's "our general scheme that we maintain business."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pumat, we'd like to introduce you to one of our friends. This is Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Sup?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beau? Well, the pleasure is respectfully mine." He reaches out, giant hand encompasses your entire fist.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Little clammy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He puts the book down. Takes his glasses off. "What can I do for you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, my mom's birthday is coming up, and she really likes boxes that have-- Do you have a lead-lined box?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We've got quite a few here currently containing items that require shielding."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we get one of those?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then we got one in the back that’s a biggie."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably the grande. The middle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was thinking the same thing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Let me go ahead and--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait! Mr. Pumat, what is it made of? What does it do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, what the nice lady there is requesting is a box that is lined with the "material known as lead."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've heard of the material, but does it have any other magical properties?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No magical properties. It’s just really useful for poisoning yourself if you put food "storage in there, poisoning other people if you store their food in it, and keeping at bay the "prying eyes of distant divination magics."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we’re probably going to need a couple of healing potions as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, to replenish.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not a problem."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m going to window shop, then! Thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don’t happen to have any articles of protection, do you? A necklace, a bracelet, a ring?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That’s a pretty protective--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was expensive, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was expensive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other one who's knitting is like, "Yeah, it’s a pretty penny because that’s a pretty item." Goes back to knitting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, how much precisely was that one again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That one will run you about 800 gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Still out of the reach there.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) How much is that doggy in the window?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We got this nice shield over here that we just had finished a couple days ago. That's an "enchanted little delightful piece. That one is a little more affordable at about 550 gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it look like, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The shield itself has the head of two lions, facing away from each other, with their claws extended. It has almost a diamond shape. It's a pretty decent size. The coloration of it is a bright gold where the lions are. The back of it is a dull, almost graphite metallic, with a gold border around the edge of it. It’s very pretty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This one? It improves your defenses more than a normal shield would. It instinctively "places the shield in places that might help protect from incoming blows, therefore making you "hard to connect with."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. That's pretty cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whispers) "It's a plus one." (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much is your fancy box?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The fancy box that you’re requesting, while not actually enchanted, it is taking away one of "the objects that we keep contained. So, respectfully, I'll have to charge you the cost of "that one and a replacement, but that'll simply put you back about 15 gold pieces total."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's probably smart, though, huh? It's probably made a bit better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go in on it. What was in the box though, originally?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is none of your concern."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much to make it my concern?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Your friend is a strange one."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She really is. She's always asking questions that are weird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She is very useful in the right circumstances.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I can entirely understand that."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm right here! I can hear you all talking about me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She can catch arrows out of midair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's really impressive."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But do you have any sort of magic incantation ability-- if I gave you a flask, could you make it never run out of alcohol?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Actually, that is a very doable enchantment. It'll take us a little while, but we "can definitely make something like that happen."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much would that R&D cost me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "About a week's worth of enchanting time, the cost will put you at about 250 gold pieces."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here's my platinum flask. Could you also put a nice little flourishy design on the side of the flask?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We can go ahead and outsource that. Yeah, we can make that happen for you, couldn't we?" The one knitting goes, "Yeah, that's not a problem at all."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That’s a lot of gold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's nothing. It's nothing at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You’re going to pay up for now, up front?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Here, take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, the whole lump sum up front!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep! All up front!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate your trust in our ability." Writes up a quick little piece of paper. Hands it to you as a receipt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should buy that box?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We definitely should. I will buy that box for us. How much was it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was 15 gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "15 gold pieces for the box. You wanted two healing potions? That’ll put you back about 100 "gold pieces for the two."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That sounds fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Any other healing potions you got?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We got probably another dozen or so more if you want to buy."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I’ll take one more as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here’s ten platinum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ten whole platinum. All right there. 50 gold from each of you. That’s a healing potion to "each of you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, I assume it is out of my reach price-wise, and I'm on a budget, but do you deal in arcane knowledge? Pre-prepared scrolls of any kind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. We have certainly many number of various scrolls and scroll types and spells. If "that's what you're looking for, we can definitely provide."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is the range? What are your lowest rung, I guess I'm curious to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Those will put you back about 50 to 100 gold, approximately."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DM, a question from Liam. Can cantrips be added if they're found?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I imagine they could.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Greater healing potion, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's a regular healing potion. Regular heal. "If you're going up from there to 2nd- or "3rd-level, those'll put you back probably closer to maybe 250-500 gold, depending, and then it "skyrockets from there."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, I am interested in everything from the second level and below. Do you have a menu?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, we have to order them from the Academy, but we can get them in here for you. Or "the Halls of Erudition."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give me a moment. Player's Handbook!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Taliesin, are you seeing-- wait, no. Are you seeing the potion of healing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go to your D&D Beyond app; it has all the manuals.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Potion of healing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm only seeing the greaters.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Careful if you’re filtering by type. I was having a problem with that. It's "potion of "healing."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably get back and put the thing in this box, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The box is presented, you pay for that, 15 gold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's black. It's not green, blue, or purple. It's black text. It took me a second to realize.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you should cancel the order. Have him make something else.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What should we have him make?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A flask.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A lead flask. It's weird, every level the intelligence gets lower.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, should we go?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold your horses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, we're looking up something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While this is happening, Pumat picks up the book again and puts the glasses on, and starts continuing to read.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was doing a look around to see if there was anything new.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did we get any healing potions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need any more, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I am very good, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll buy a healing potion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so another 50 off you. 12, nothing at the moment. It's only been a few days, and the enchantment process and/or the coming in of new objects can take a while to stock back up. The shield is the most recent creation that was presented. That's the only new one you see. Other than that, there's still the pearl, there's still the cloak. A few other odds and small wands.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The cloak was the most exciting thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you ever had a chance-- Pumat Prime, rather-- have you had a chance to exercise your arcane abilities?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, if you want Pumat Prime, he's in the back. I can go get him for you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, if you wouldn't mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." He puts the book down on the counter, glasses off, turns around, leaves. Comes back in, takes the glasses, puts them on, takes the book, and continues reading, while Pumat Prime comes from the back, once again, the large set of goggle glasses on, the apron on. "I was told that "I was requested to greet you with a 'hello!'"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is happening?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: These are all-- What's the correct term?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sicrulalium?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Simulacrum. That's the one, yeah. I know, it's a little confusing."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pumat, I wanted to ask, we're such fans of your store, did you ever find call to, I don't know, use your magic for combat? What led you to a store like this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's kind of a personal story. Let's just say I didn't get along with my peers at a young "age, and found myself wandering. Got picked up by some nice mages that saw some potential. Took me "in and helped me hone my craft, and helped me set up a store, and here I am in Zadash."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's great. How many years have you had this store?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Been running this place for a good 12 years."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Congratulations. It's really a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What mages were you with? What mages found you? Were they with the Academy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sort of. They were with the Cerberus Assembly."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right, you were talking about them before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. They really--" Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It gets caught in the corners.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shake it out of the corners of the giant flask.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is hiding in those corners, though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The main person who's been of aid to me is the Headmaster Oremid Hass, who runs the Hall of "Erudition."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We still haven't gone there, have we? We've heard about it, like, seven times!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He runs the Hall of Erudition?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's the Headmaster of the Hall." He scratches his chin for a second. "He's the "Archmage of Cultivation within the Cerberus Assembly. He's been a real nice beacon of "tutelage. He's a bit rough on the edges, and seems tough, but he's a softie. Especially when it comes "to small critters. Don't tell him I said that." For that one moment, you see a look of fear in his eyes.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LIAM
lines.text: Small critters.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, he likes small critters? Like me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe? I don't know. Anyway, I got to get back to work." He quickly goes into the back room again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks for your time, Pumat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't mention it!" The one that's reading off to the sides goes--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's cool, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That guy's crazy!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's actually still here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's get back to business. I don't know what you have on tap here, but I'm looking for something, just a cantrip, pretty common, shocking--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Shocking Grasp. I know what you're talking about."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know how it works?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I got it myself. Anyone want to see?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All righty. I like the gumption." He goes and gives a big old handshake to Beauregard. Let me look that up real fast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know what I'm agreeing to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an auto-hit, because you're reaching out to it. You immediately grab his giant mitt, and a flash of white light and pain as electricity rocks through your body. You take three points of lightning damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (yelps) Fuck!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is the one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That one will run you 75 gold pieces."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excellent. Pause. The other thing--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hands. They look paws-ish, but yeah."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The other one that I am interested in that is not really my forte, but many wizards believe it is of great benefit. Do you have the Shield spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We can get you a Shield spell. That's a pretty standard defensive mechanism for those of "the arcane persuasion."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much will that run me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He thumbs through the ledger. "That one will cost you about 200 gold pieces."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will take the pair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All righty there."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was the first one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shocking Grasp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll be twinsies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Comes back with two scrolls and sets them on the table.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will take those. Thank you very much,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My pleasure."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you just call him "asshole?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait a minute, what does that mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who's on first?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's get that thing in its box.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anything else you guys require, or can you leave me to my reading?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whatcha reading?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's a collection of crazy tales about this weird fella."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's The Daring Trials and Tribulations of Sir Taryon Darrington. This guy's been all over "the place. It's kind of wild." (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow. Ten episodes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fiction, or...?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it's got to be fiction. (laughter) But it's good fiction!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, sum it up for me. Give me the Tenser's Floating Disk pitch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And apparently, according to this thing, there's these powerful folks from over there in Tal'Dorei that he's been meeting up with that keep messing up every time they go on an adventure! Real thorns in his side!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We can relate. I'm a big reader. If you finish that, I don't know if you are the kind of fellow who likes to keep every book he reads but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I got a collection.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, I got this shipped out to me from Deastok. Perhaps if you are in that vicinity, see that you get yourself a copy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bestseller or used book?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I had never heard of it until this, so probably not that easy to find.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you be able to put in an order for this book for me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, I'm not really a book retailer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I understand, but you know many people. You are obviously a very knowledgeable fellow who has vast connections.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I bet we could go back to the Chastity's Nook for that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They will probably have it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is probably a place to look for a book.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It sounds like smut to me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a dirty book?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Well, I wait for your full review. Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You just wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's called "The Daring Tales."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sounds like shite, Caleb. There are much better books out there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go. Come on, there are things that need to be taken care of, Caleb!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: True. I got distracted. You know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pumat, thanks for your time. We will not be bothering you any longer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we will be back because we like you so much!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are always welcome any time! All of us are happy to see you come in and spend your hard-earned money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Goodbye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bye-bye!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go! Come on, we've got to get back to the Tap!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We double dash back to the Tap.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To the Tap? Why are we going there now? Oh, to the box thing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and to look at the stuff Caleb identified for us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys return. Do you head down to the basement?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I make sure it's still there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's still there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's put it in the thing!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I put the box right down next to me and I put my coat--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the skeleton alive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the skeleton is still dead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He didn't bring anything back to life, that's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have monster calves, do you want to carry this now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What, like, on me all the time?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he's holding it, placing it over the box, there's still that undulating low hum and grayish glow--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I can carry this box with me all the time, but don't you think it's weird to carry around a box all the time?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, people carry boxes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we put the box in the--?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The bag?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wait, we can't put the box in the bag.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Crossing the streams.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But now we can put the dodecah-shit-ball in the box and now the box in the bag, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Still crossing the streams.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still crossing the streams?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The lead is just to protect this item from divination.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 22. Plus four.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am worried about crossing two planes of existence. It might not be that at all, but it is definitely not worth chancing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The essence, as you're looking at this and concentrating on this object, trying to get a grasp on it now that you have a good moment to look at it. The school of magic, or whatever the source of the magic is here, escapes you. It seems almost beyond or separate than some of the magics that you've naturally learned through your acquisition of spells and the pact that you had made. But you don't get the sense that it's extraplanar or anything that would constitute the same level of danger that you think Caleb is focused on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tell me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I say that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What, you have experience with things of this nature?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It seems like a different sort of arcana than the type that I've seen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, well, that's fine. I'm going to walk about 200 feet away from you when you put it in that bag--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that's a TPK. You plop it in the bag and it vanishes inside the pouch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long does it take to take effect if we're all going to die?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It takes about two weeks, so I guess we’ll find out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eventually! I put my bag back on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What else we got?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh yes, very good things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, the items!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The daggers are just daggers, okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take those.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is for you to look at. Then these boots would make anyone better, but I think that Beauregard might benefit from them the most. I could be wrong; I'm going to give them to Beau and let you decide.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it? What are they? What do they do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The downside is longswords are not finesse weapons, so you'd have to use strength to utilize it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's pretty dope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pretty dope.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is really bloody heavy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You could actually--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could I use that? A longsword?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, well, are you proficient with weapons like a longsword? Your weapon proficiencies? My Player's Handbook keeps disappearing from me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why do we only have one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's another one, it's just gone missing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know someone who might really enjoy this if you don't want it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have like 30 Handbooks around here somewhere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We took them all outside and they stayed there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I put that down? I might have written my proficiencies--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many weapons can you wield?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Simple weapons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so you could not use a longsword.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I know somebody who could really enjoy this, and I'll hold on to it for a friend.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could Yasha use that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think Yasha might get a kick out of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! That’s great!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, is she still a thing? She's going to come back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gone forever!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've known Yasha a long time, she makes her way back around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Although that greatsword she has is mighty fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, we will probably never see her again, that seems a little foolish to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hope she's still in the city, because otherwise she's going to have a really hard time trying to get back in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll eventually need a bath and we'll find her again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could one of us carry it until she returns? Who could really use it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think anyone can use it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not you? You are so good with a sword!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, certainly. I just have a preference with mine. I'm just real comfortable with it. You know when you get a feel for something, you don't want to change it up too much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It’s worth holding onto.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I respect her ability to handle her own shit on her own time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do the boots do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They’re pretty great! So I strap on the big, gothy boots--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Big-ass tall Doc Martens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Super tall Doc Martens, lots of little fur-lined, lots of straps and zippers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These boots are designed in a similar style as to the armor of the Xhorhasian individual you had fought.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it kind of obvious?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not obvious. They’re made of a very dark brown or black leather with studs and the tops of them curl up into two spikes at the tip at each side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do they look?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, normally you're barefoot so it looks pretty good. It makes your pants billow a little weird but I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it’s hard to tuck your pants into your boots.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought you would like those. Was I right? I was right, wasn't I?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're pretty great. They add 1d8 to my initiative roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Once per day. So you can choose a moment to get the jump.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does anyone else feel like they might benefit from these more than me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, anybody would, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I’m pretty good with this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (exaggerated cough) No, you keep them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Your initiative bonus is zero?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but you know Beauregard really is the most capable fighter in this group, at this moment in time. What? That’s just the truth. Can you handle the truth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like Nott might be able to do some good with these too, if she had them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I defer to the wisdom of the group. We merely follow your expert wisdom.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I’m sensing some passive aggressive--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! I am sincere!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Just smile and say, "Thank you, Nott."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you, Nott.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Very good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Very good. Thank you. Thank you, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I saw your gums for a second. It was freaky.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't patronize me, Nott.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, I take out the Wand of Smiles and I cast it at her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you have to make a saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, do I?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I forgot we had that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What kind of a saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is it a wisdom saving throw?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Charisma.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's not good for me. Nope, definitely not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, for the next minute, your face is curled up into a Joker-like smile.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I love making people happy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now you look so happy! It's so wonderful!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (voice cracking) I am so happy!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So we should-- ugh, just look at them!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should probably do something. We still have to wrap up this deception of ours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. What are we supposed to do now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (brightly) Go talk to the Gentleman, of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But wait--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You sound like The General car insurance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) 1-800-General!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does The General have to do with--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Gentleman.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does the Gentleman have to do with this plan, though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We were going to investigate Kara, who was going to the bar that the Gentleman frequents.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's what it was. Okay, so we go to the Evening Nip to investigate her, and then we just happen to talk to the Gentleman, too?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If it happens, if it comes up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But also, we did not get the full catch-up, Fjord. What about the remnants of-- I know everything is

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah, we have to send the guards to find the evidence! Oh god!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We can't do anything. Dolan was going to handle that part of this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like it's all gone to shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I think that's right, actually. I forgot that part.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if it's all a distraction, though, for the big stuff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think that's exactly what this is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm wondering if the guards are already there looking at the mysterious explosion that happened in that house.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But Lord Sutan probably went home and noticed his rug was missing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Absolutely noticed that the very expensive magical rug is gone!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And so did he go to the guards, or did he go, "Oh shit, I was hiding something?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we plant something in Lord Sutan's house, are they going to find the letter from--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we stole a seal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Listen, this could all appear like the Knights turned on the High-Richter. I thought we wanted to get rid of Lord Sutan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, but we put evidence in his house. So if he noticed that the rug was missing--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He goes to the Crownsguard to report a robbery. Then they go in and they find the evidence that he was actually trying to be behind the attack that happened. So it actually is good that we destroyed the rug, because it led the guards into his house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if he would report a robbery if he had a Rug of Attacking and you triggered it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And actual connections to the Myriad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he-- Are you okay, Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Smiling is so painful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It can be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go spy on his house, and see if there are crownsguard in it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could certainly go by.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think they would let anyone back into the Tri-Spire?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit, I forgot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It’ll flip the situation. Dolan, I believe, was saying that with the High-Richter in place, she was favoring Sutan. And now she is gone, Dolan will hopefully take that seat. If he takes that seat, Dolan is not going to protect Lord Sutan in the way that he claimed that the High-Richter was.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, maybe we walk away from the whole thing. Discuss it as a possibility.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got paid already. How much did I get paid? Because it was minus Kara's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Minus Kara's, that would have been 628 gold, 21 silver, and 302 copper.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, did we get paid?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what's the plan?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, here's the thing. If Dolan assumes that seat-- we have no idea if that's going to happen, but if Dolan does take that Richter's seat, Sutan, if nothing happens to him, if no guards go into Sutan's house, he knows that his rug is gone, he realizes someone has been in his home, 100%, he looks through the home himself, finds our fake message from the Myriad or whoever, would he retaliate on Dolan? Do we care?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe he was a pawn this whole time. That guy is kind of a coward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I mean this with all due respect -- the guy was kind of a coward!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am sad that I did that to her, because--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's how you do it, right? No?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if they'll send anything back on Dolan, but we should find a way to get crownsguard into Lord Sutan's place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it was Dolan who said, I believe, he had the relationship with Orentha, so he was going to report this stuff to Orentha and have crownsguard go in. Now, due to the circumstances of the evening, we have missed the element of a quick surprise. They did not rush in the way we had hoped. So he's already realized somebody has jacked his shit. I'm not worried, really, about him finding

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can't have Dolan rat on him. Hmm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But if we don't give a shit about Dolan, then there's no problem, really. But maybe we do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm wondering if she's a puppet master throughout this whole game.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's try that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we'll go to the Evening Nip?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Let's try that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you guys are going to the Evening Nip? All right. You make your way over to the familiar, dirty, small, sunken dive bar, the same two beefy-looking guards on the outside eyeing you as you enter. You come inside. The same two individuals sitting at the the same booth and the far table. And there lies Clive Binz, the dwarf with the half-burned beard. As you enter, he's like, "Ah, good to see you again. What can I get you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's something along the lines of-- Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we gonna do this? Are we doing the Gentleman?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is Clive the bartender, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Clive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we are. So Beau and Jester walk up, and say--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Sup.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can I get you anything?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I know I'd like a drink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I would like some milk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: However, we are willing to offer many gifts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. Well, then. Take these gifts with you." He turns around and looks at the rest of you, and steps into the back room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we follow him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm so scared right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you follow him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we fucking follow him into the room!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You step into the back room of this dive, and as you step inside, it's a storage cupboard. There's shelves up there with various bottles of liquor, wine, and ale. He's currently pulling a small chain up on the corner. As he does, you watch as a small trap door goes (creaking), it winches up, and there's a stairway that leads down. And he goes--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mazel tov.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you hear some voices and some laughter, and a clink of glasses. As you curve down, the light gets brighter from around the corner, until suddenly you look into a stone-set subterranean tavern. From floor to ceiling, it's about 20 feet tall. You can see there are two balconies that overlook it from the left side, and one that's barely visible around the corner, as the room opens up to the right of you. There's a table immediately down from where the spiral staircase ends, and there's a gruff-looking fellow sitting there looking up as you enter. He looks immediately defensive. The rest of the people in there are drinking, and not immediately paying attention. As you begin to descend the stairway, who all’s going in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You all begin to descend to the bottom of the stairs. There's maybe about a dozen or so people in here, between the bartender, folks, and you can see two people are playing music on the upper balcony. There's laughter and discussion, and there's a card game at the center table. You see a maroon and dull grey robed person arrive, but their body is covered with a dark black, almost panther-like fur. Their face is cat-like, with ears that curl up. This is a black tabaxi that has turned around the corner, and goes, "Halt, friends. I do not recognize-- Lucien?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who? What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (incredulous) "You're alive!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, sorry, friend, I've got one of those faces people tend to recognize.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (gasping in disbelief) "Lucien!" She goes forward and does a huge hug.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'll go with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we're going to end tonight's episode! (screaming)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (shouting) Insight check! Insight check on Taliesin! Insight check!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a d10, that doesn't matter.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Lucien?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lucien?! That's a cool name!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?! Who's that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who the fuck?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody's a liar!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's eight more names to come!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's actually a robot!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look at Taliesin right now. Just look at him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You sneaky bastard!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You fuckers don't know shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You fake-name-making motherfucker!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many names have you had?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: An hour ago you were telling me that I had to

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we never said to trust us! We said

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't say anything!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. We'll pick up from

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (giggles) Until then, we love you guys. Have a wonderful week, and is it Thursday yet? Good night! [music]
